page.title: 03The (St.Stephen's) Beacon
page.content: The Beacon is a dome-like hill which under different circumstances would doubtless be one of the dominating features of the local landscape. It is however now dwarfed by the clay workings around it. A short and easy path to the summit leaves the road from{Foxhole}to{Goonabarn}just after the railway bridge.Formerly the remains of a fortification around the hill were visible.On a clear day both Cornwall's coastlines can be seen.Just below the hill in the middle of a meadow to the S.W. can be seen remains of an old{tin mine.}Further remains lie by the pits between this field and the Beacon.Workers from this mine were removing stone from the Beacon summit around 1864 when they discovered a { {stone coffin.}Inside were four gallons of ashes and a seal bearing the{ {Masonic arms.}
